thread.title_full: Colleges | Muskingum coach charged for throwing bottle at player | Buckeye Xtra Sports

author: The Columbus Dispatch
title: Colleges | Muskingum coach charged for throwing bottle at player | Buckeye Xtra Sports
text:
The Muskingum women’s volleyball coach was charged with misdemeanor assault after reportedly throwing a water bottle at a student’s head.
A volleyball player told police she made a comment about being able to smell her own feet during a sit-down coaching session on Oct. 8. After her comment, coach Elizabeth Zicha threw the water bottle at her, striking her in the left side of her face, according to police reports.
>> Get the most out of your Ohio State experience, follow @BuckeyeXtra on Twitter 
The player also told police Zicha had also previously struck her on the back with a volleyball antenna.
Zicha was charged with the single misdemeanor count last week in the New Concord Mayor’s Court.
The university is not commenting on the case.
Zicha has a 658-361 record and has won six Ohio Athletic Conference championships. She is also a professor in the university’s physical education department.
jsmola@dispatch.com 
@jennsmola
